solution_line_template: At the end of the day, he had tested {boards_tested} boards, each with {tacks_per_board} tacks, for a total of {tacks_per_board}*{boards_tested}=<<{boards_tested}*{tacks_per_board}={tacks_used}>>{tacks_used} tacks

He had {tacks_remaining_per_can} tacks remaining in each of the {cans} cans, for an additional {cans}*{tacks_remaining_per_can}=<<{cans}*{tacks_remaining_per_can}={tacks_remaining}>>{tacks_remaining} thumbs tacks.

Therefore, the original total combined number of thumbtacks in the three full cans of thumbtacks was {tacks_used}+{tacks_remaining}=<<{tacks_used}+{tacks_remaining}={total_tacks}>>{total_tacks} thumbtacks.
